body:
Thank you for your pull request. Before we can look at your contribution, we need to ensure all contributors are covered by a Contributor License Agreement.

After the following items are addressed, please respond with a new comment here, and the automated system will re-verify.

* User @daniel-j-born isn't covered by a CLA. They will need to complete the form at https://identity.linuxfoundation.org/projects/cncf

_Regards,
The Linux Foundation CLA GitHub bot_

A required test is flaky and blocking merge: "Portability Tests Linux [Build Only] (internal CI)"

Looks like it was a timeout.  I've asked Kokoro to rerun it.

Please tag known issues for any other failures before merging.
How do I find known issues and how do I tag them?

Known issues: #12917 #13426 #13446 #13404 #13460 #12510 #13445 

Please squash your commits before merging.

The same required test is failing, so I can't merge ("Portability Tests Linux [Build Only] (internal CI)").

How do I trigger a rebuild in Kokoro?

Can you just disable all the merge requirements until you get them fixed?

I've asked kokoro to rebuild the required test.

It's unusual for this particular test to be flaky, and the check is important, which is why it's required.

Still fails.

Log entries of note:
"Internal CI infrastructure error. Please ignore for now."

It looks like the tests pass ("PASSED: run_tests_c_linux_dbg_native_x86_default_buildonly"), but there is some ssh/rsync error when collecting the results.
Ping - How can I retry the tests? They're flaky and this PR has been stuck for a while because of it.
It's unfortunately complicated to re-run just one test.  I've asked Kokoro to run it again.  Let's see what happens.
